trans-unit.source: On-premises application with blob storage (Java) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: On-premises application with blob storage (Java) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create a console application that uploads an image to Azure, and then displays the image in your browser. Code samples in Java.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create a console application that uploads an image to Azure, and then displays the image in your browser. Code samples in Java.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows you how you can use Azure storage to store images in Azure.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows you how you can use Azure storage to store images in Azure.

trans-unit.source: The code in this article is for a console application that uploads an image to Azure, and then creates an HTML file that displays the image in your browser.
trans-unit.target: The code in this article is for a console application that uploads an image to Azure, and then creates an HTML file that displays the image in your browser.

trans-unit.source: A Java Developer Kit (JDK), version 1.6 or later, is installed.
trans-unit.target: A Java Developer Kit (JDK), version 1.6 or later, is installed.

trans-unit.source: The Azure SDK is installed.
trans-unit.target: The Azure SDK is installed.

trans-unit.source: The JAR for the Azure Libraries for Java, and any applicable dependency JARs, are installed and are in the build path used by your Java compiler.
trans-unit.target: The JAR for the Azure Libraries for Java, and any applicable dependency JARs, are installed and are in the build path used by your Java compiler.

trans-unit.source: For information about installing the Azure Libraries for Java, see <linkText>Download the Azure SDK for Java</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information about installing the Azure Libraries for Java, see <linkText>Download the Azure SDK for Java</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: An Azure storage account has been set up.
trans-unit.target: An Azure storage account has been set up.

trans-unit.source: The account name and account key for the storage account will be used by the code in this article.
trans-unit.target: The account name and account key for the storage account will be used by the code in this article.

trans-unit.source: See [How to Create a Storage Account] for information about creating a storage account, and <linkText>How to Manage Storage Accounts</linkText><title></title> for information about retrieving the account key.
trans-unit.target: See [How to Create a Storage Account] for information about creating a storage account, and <linkText>How to Manage Storage Accounts</linkText><title></title> for information about retrieving the account key.

trans-unit.source: You have created a local image file named stored at the path c:\\myimages\\image1.jpg.
trans-unit.target: You have created a local image file named stored at the path c:\\myimages\\image1.jpg.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, modify the FileInputStream constructor in the example to use a different image path and file name.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, modify the FileInputStream constructor in the example to use a different image path and file name.

trans-unit.source: A step-by-step procedure is presented here.
trans-unit.target: A step-by-step procedure is presented here.

trans-unit.source: If you'd like to skip ahead, the entire code is presented later in this article.
trans-unit.target: If you'd like to skip ahead, the entire code is presented later in this article.

trans-unit.source: Begin the code by including imports for the Azure core storage classes, the Azure blob client classes, the Java IO classes, and the URISyntaxException class.
trans-unit.target: Begin the code by including imports for the Azure core storage classes, the Azure blob client classes, the Java IO classes, and the URISyntaxException class.

trans-unit.source: Declare a class named StorageSample, and include the open bracket, {.
trans-unit.target: Declare a class named StorageSample, and include the open bracket, {.

trans-unit.source: Within the StorageSample class, declare a string variable that will contain the default endpoint protocol, your storage account name, and your storage access key, as specified in your Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: Within the StorageSample class, declare a string variable that will contain the default endpoint protocol, your storage account name, and your storage access key, as specified in your Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: Replace the placeholder values your\_account\_name and your\_account\_key with your own account name and account key, respectively.
trans-unit.target: Replace the placeholder values your\_account\_name and your\_account\_key with your own account name and account key, respectively.

trans-unit.source: Add in your declaration for main, include a try block, and include the necessary open brackets, {.
trans-unit.target: Add in your declaration for main, include a try block, and include the necessary open brackets, {.

trans-unit.source: Declare variables of the following type (the descriptions are for how they are used in this example):
trans-unit.target: Declare variables of the following type (the descriptions are for how they are used in this example):

trans-unit.source: CloudStorageAccount: Used to initialize the account object with your Azure storage account name and key, and to create the blob client object.
trans-unit.target: CloudStorageAccount: Used to initialize the account object with your Azure storage account name and key, and to create the blob client object.

trans-unit.source: CloudBlobClient: Used to access the blob service.
trans-unit.target: CloudBlobClient: Used to access the blob service.

trans-unit.source: CloudBlobContainer: Used to create a blob container, list the blobs in the container, and delete the container.
trans-unit.target: CloudBlobContainer: Used to create a blob container, list the blobs in the container, and delete the container.

trans-unit.source: CloudBlockBlob: Used to upload a local image file to the container.
trans-unit.target: CloudBlockBlob: Used to upload a local image file to the container.

trans-unit.source: Assign a value to the account variable.
trans-unit.target: Assign a value to the account variable.

trans-unit.source: Assign a value to the serviceClient variable.
trans-unit.target: Assign a value to the serviceClient variable.

trans-unit.source: Assign a value to the container variable.
trans-unit.target: Assign a value to the container variable.

trans-unit.source: We'll get a reference to a container named gettingstarted.
trans-unit.target: We'll get a reference to a container named gettingstarted.

trans-unit.source: Create the container.
trans-unit.target: Create the container.

trans-unit.source: This method will create the container if it doesn't exist (and return true).
trans-unit.target: This method will create the container if it doesn't exist (and return true).

trans-unit.source: If the container does exist, it will return false.
trans-unit.target: If the container does exist, it will return false.

trans-unit.source: An alternative to createIfNotExists is the create method (which will return an error if the container already exists).
trans-unit.target: An alternative to createIfNotExists is the create method (which will return an error if the container already exists).

trans-unit.source: Set anonymous access for the container.
trans-unit.target: Set anonymous access for the container.

trans-unit.source: Get a reference to the block blob, which will represent the blob in Azure storage.
trans-unit.target: Get a reference to the block blob, which will represent the blob in Azure storage.

trans-unit.source: Use the File constructor to get a reference to the locally created file that you will upload.
trans-unit.target: Use the File constructor to get a reference to the locally created file that you will upload.

trans-unit.source: Ensure you have created this file before running the code.
trans-unit.target: Ensure you have created this file before running the code.

trans-unit.source: Upload the local file through a call to the CloudBlockBlob.upload method.
trans-unit.target: Upload the local file through a call to the CloudBlockBlob.upload method.

trans-unit.source: The first parameter to the CloudBlockBlob.upload method is a FileInputStream object that represents the local file that will be uploaded to Azure storage.
trans-unit.target: The first parameter to the CloudBlockBlob.upload method is a FileInputStream object that represents the local file that will be uploaded to Azure storage.

trans-unit.source: The second parameter is the size, in bytes, of the file.
trans-unit.target: The second parameter is the size, in bytes, of the file.

trans-unit.source: Call a helper function named MakeHTMLPage, to make a basic HTML page that contains an <image> element with the source set to the blob that is now in your Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: Call a helper function named MakeHTMLPage, to make a basic HTML page that contains an <image> element with the source set to the blob that is now in your Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: The code for MakeHTMLPage will be discussed later in this article.
trans-unit.target: The code for MakeHTMLPage will be discussed later in this article.

trans-unit.source: Print out a status message and information about the created HTML page.
trans-unit.target: Print out a status message and information about the created HTML page.

trans-unit.source: Close the try block by inserting a close bracket: }
trans-unit.target: Close the try block by inserting a close bracket: }

trans-unit.source: Handle the following exceptions:
trans-unit.target: Handle the following exceptions:

trans-unit.source: FileNotFoundException: Can be thrown by the FileInputStream or FileOutputStream constructors.
trans-unit.target: FileNotFoundException: Can be thrown by the FileInputStream or FileOutputStream constructors.

trans-unit.source: StorageException: Can be thrown by the Azure client storage library.
trans-unit.target: StorageException: Can be thrown by the Azure client storage library.

trans-unit.source: URISyntaxException: Can be thrown by the ListBlobItem.getUri method.
trans-unit.target: URISyntaxException: Can be thrown by the ListBlobItem.getUri method.

trans-unit.source: Exception: Generic exception handling.
trans-unit.target: Exception: Generic exception handling.

trans-unit.source: Close main by inserting a close bracket: }
trans-unit.target: Close main by inserting a close bracket: }

trans-unit.source: Create a method named MakeHTMLPage to create a basic HTML page.
trans-unit.target: Create a method named MakeHTMLPage to create a basic HTML page.

trans-unit.source: This method has a parameter of type CloudBlobContainer, which will be used to iterate through the list of uploaded blobs.
trans-unit.target: This method has a parameter of type CloudBlobContainer, which will be used to iterate through the list of uploaded blobs.

trans-unit.source: This method will throw exceptions of type FileNotFoundException, which can be thrown by the FileOutputStream constructor, and URISyntaxException, which can be thrown by the ListBlobItem.getUri method.
trans-unit.target: This method will throw exceptions of type FileNotFoundException, which can be thrown by the FileOutputStream constructor, and URISyntaxException, which can be thrown by the ListBlobItem.getUri method.

trans-unit.source: Include the opening bracket, {.
trans-unit.target: Include the opening bracket, {.

trans-unit.source: Create a local file named index.html.
trans-unit.target: Create a local file named index.html.

trans-unit.source: Write to the local file, adding in the <html>, <header>, and <body> elements.
trans-unit.target: Write to the local file, adding in the <html>, <header>, and <body> elements.

trans-unit.source: Iterate through the list of uploaded blobs.
trans-unit.target: Iterate through the list of uploaded blobs.

trans-unit.source: For each blob, in the HTML page create an <img> element that has its src attribute sent to the URI of the blob as it exists in your Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: For each blob, in the HTML page create an <img> element that has its src attribute sent to the URI of the blob as it exists in your Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: Although you added only one image in this sample, if you added more, this code would iterate all of them.
trans-unit.target: Although you added only one image in this sample, if you added more, this code would iterate all of them.

trans-unit.source: For simplicity, this example assumes each uploaded blob is an image.
trans-unit.target: For simplicity, this example assumes each uploaded blob is an image.

trans-unit.source: If you've updated blobs other than images, or page blobs instead of block blobs, adjust the code as needed.
trans-unit.target: If you've updated blobs other than images, or page blobs instead of block blobs, adjust the code as needed.

trans-unit.source: Close the <body> element and the <html> element.
trans-unit.target: Close the <body> element and the <html> element.

trans-unit.source: Close the local file.
trans-unit.target: Close the local file.

trans-unit.source: Close MakeHTMLPage by inserting a close bracket: }
trans-unit.target: Close MakeHTMLPage by inserting a close bracket: }

trans-unit.source: Close StorageSample by inserting a close bracket: }
trans-unit.target: Close StorageSample by inserting a close bracket: }

trans-unit.source: The following is the complete code for this example.
trans-unit.target: The following is the complete code for this example.

trans-unit.source: Remember to modify the placeholder values your\_account\_name and your\_account\_key to use your account name and account key, respectively.
trans-unit.target: Remember to modify the placeholder values your\_account\_name and your\_account\_key to use your account name and account key, respectively.

trans-unit.source: In addition to uploading your local image file to Azure storage, the example code creates a local file namedindex.html, which you can open in your browser to see your uploaded image.
trans-unit.target: In addition to uploading your local image file to Azure storage, the example code creates a local file namedindex.html, which you can open in your browser to see your uploaded image.

trans-unit.source: Because the code contains your account name and account key, ensure that your source code is secure.
trans-unit.target: Because the code contains your account name and account key, ensure that your source code is secure.

trans-unit.source: Because you are charged for storage, you may want to delete the gettingstarted container after you are done experimenting with this example.
trans-unit.target: Because you are charged for storage, you may want to delete the gettingstarted container after you are done experimenting with this example.

trans-unit.source: To delete a container, use the CloudBlobContainer.delete method.
trans-unit.target: To delete a container, use the CloudBlobContainer.delete method.

trans-unit.source: To call the CloudBlobContainer.delete method, the process of initializing CloudStorageAccount, ClodBlobClient, and CloudBlobContainer objects is the same as shown for the createIfNotExist method.
trans-unit.target: To call the CloudBlobContainer.delete method, the process of initializing CloudStorageAccount, ClodBlobClient, and CloudBlobContainer objects is the same as shown for the createIfNotExist method.

trans-unit.source: The following is a complete example that deletes the container named gettingstarted.
trans-unit.target: The following is a complete example that deletes the container named gettingstarted.

trans-unit.source: For an overview of other blob storage classes and methods, see [How to use the blob storage service from Java].
trans-unit.target: For an overview of other blob storage classes and methods, see [How to use the blob storage service from Java].

trans-unit.source: Follow these links to learn more about more complex storage tasks.
trans-unit.target: Follow these links to learn more about more complex storage tasks.
